channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: LLM-FSM: Scaling Large Language Models for Finite-State Reasoning in RTL Code Generation
item.description: arXiv:2602.07032v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Finite-state reasoning, the ability to understand and implement state-dependent behavior, is central to hardware design. In this paper, we present LLM-FSM, a benchmark that evaluates how well large language models (LLMs) can recover finite-state...

item.title: ST-Raptor: An Agentic System for Semi-Structured Table QA
item.description: arXiv:2602.07034v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Semi-structured table question answering (QA) is a challenging task that requires (1) precise extraction of cell contents and positions and (2) accurate recovery of key implicit logical structures, hierarchical relationships, and semantic associations...

item.title: DLLM-Searcher: Adapting Diffusion Large Language Model for Search Agents
item.description: arXiv:2602.07035v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recently, Diffusion Large Language Models (dLLMs) have demonstrated unique efficiency advantages, enabled by their inherently parallel decoding mechanism and flexible generation paradigm. Meanwhile, despite the rapid advancement of Search Agents,...

item.title: Aster: Autonomous Scientific Discovery over 20x Faster Than Existing Methods
item.description: arXiv:2602.07040v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce Aster, an AI agent for autonomous scientific discovery capable of operating over 20 times faster than existing frameworks. Given a task, an initial program, and a script to evaluate the performance of the program, Aster iteratively...

item.title: Theory of Space: Can Foundation Models Construct Spatial Beliefs through Active Exploration?
item.description: arXiv:2602.07055v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Spatial embodied intelligence requires agents to act to acquire information under partial observability. While multimodal foundation models excel at passive perception, their capacity for active, self-directed exploration remains understudied. We...

item.title: Attractor Patch Networks: Reducing Catastrophic Forgetting with Routed Low-Rank Patch Experts
item.description: arXiv:2602.06993v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Transformers achieve strong language modeling accuracy, yet their position-wise feed-forward networks (FFNs) are dense, globally shared, and typically updated end to end. These properties create two practical tensions. First, dense FFNs spend the same...

item.title: Neural Sabermetrics with World Model: Play-by-play Predictive Modeling with Large Language Model
item.description: arXiv:2602.07030v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Classical sabermetrics has profoundly shaped baseball analytics by summarizing long histories of play into compact statistics. While these metrics are invaluable for valuation and retrospective analysis, they do not define a generative model of how...

item.title: Lagged backward-compatible physics-informed neural networks for unsaturated soil consolidation analysis
item.description: arXiv:2602.07031v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This study develops a Lagged Backward-Compatible Physics-Informed Neural Network (LBC-PINN) for simulating and inverting one-dimensional unsaturated soil consolidation under long-term loading. To address the challenges of coupled air and water...

item.title: TransConv-DDPM: Enhanced Diffusion Model for Generating Time-Series Data in Healthcare
item.description: arXiv:2602.07033v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The lack of real-world data in clinical fields poses a major obstacle in training effective AI models for diagnostic and preventive tools in medicine. Generative AI has shown promise in increasing data volume and enhancing model training, particularly...

item.title: AVERE: Improving Audiovisual Emotion Reasoning with Preference Optimization
item.description: arXiv:2602.07054v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Emotion understanding is essential for building socially intelligent agents. Although recent multimodal large language models have shown strong performance on this task, two key challenges remain - spurious associations between emotions and irrelevant...

item.title: Can One-sided Arguments Lead to Response Change in Large Language Models?
item.description: arXiv:2602.06260v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Polemic questions need more than one viewpoint to express a balanced answer. Large Language Models (LLMs) can provide a balanced answer, but also take a single aligned viewpoint or refuse to answer. In this paper, we study if such initial responses...

item.title: Is my model "mind blurting"? Interpreting the dynamics of reasoning tokens with Recurrence Quantification Analysis (RQA)
item.description: arXiv:2602.06266v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Test-time compute is central to large reasoning models, yet analysing their reasoning behaviour through generated text is increasingly impractical and unreliable. Response length is often used as a brute proxy for reasoning effort, but this metric...

item.title: MPIB: A Benchmark for Medical Prompt Injection Attacks and Clinical Safety in LLMs
item.description: arXiv:2602.06268v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems are increasingly integrated into clinical workflows; however, prompt injection attacks can steer these systems toward clinically unsafe or misleading outputs. We introduce...

item.title: VowelPrompt: Hearing Speech Emotions from Text via Vowel-level Prosodic Augmentation
item.description: arXiv:2602.06270v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Emotion recognition in speech presents a complex multimodal challenge, requiring comprehension of both linguistic content and vocal expressivity, particularly prosodic features such as fundamental frequency, intensity, and temporal dynamics. Although...

item.title: RoPE-LIME: RoPE-Space Locality + Sparse-K Sampling for Efficient LLM Attribution
item.description: arXiv:2602.06275v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Explaining closed-source LLM outputs is challenging because API access prevents gradient-based attribution, while perturbation methods are costly and noisy when they depend on regenerated text. We introduce RoPE-LIME, an open-source extension of...

item.title: [AINews] "Sci-Fi with a touch of Madness"
item.description: a quiet day lets us reflect on a pithy quote from the ClawFather.

item.title: MossCode Raises Million-Dollar Angel Round at a $100 Million Valuation
item.description: AI sports wearables startup MossCode has secured a million-dollar angel round at a $100 million valuation as it prepares to launch in Europe and the U.S. in 2026.

item.title: Pony.ai Rolls Out First Mass-Produced Toyota bZ4X Robotaxi
item.description: Pony.ai and Toyota have reached a major milestone as the first mass-produced Toyota bZ4X Robotaxi rolls off the line, paving the way for large-scale autonomous ride-hailing in China.

item.title: Alibaba’s Next-Generation Open-Source Model Qwen 3.5 Comes Into Focus
item.description: Alibaba is preparing to release Qwen 3.5, a next-generation open-source, multimodal model expected to headline a wave of major AI launches during the 2026 Lunar New Year.

item.title: Xiaohongshu Is Quietly Developing an AI Video Editor Called OpenStoryline
item.description: Xiaohongshu is quietly building OpenStoryline, an AI-driven conversational video editor aimed at dramatically lowering the barrier to short-form content creation.

item.title: Food Delivery Reaches the Boarding Gate: Meituan’s Little Bumblebee Robots Go Live
item.description: Meituan has launched its Little Bumblebee autonomous delivery robots at Nanjing Lukou International Airport, enabling passengers to order food and receive it directly at their boarding gates.

item.description: The funding was raised over Series A and seed funding rounds for its supply chain security solution. The post Lema AI Emerges From Stealth With $24 Million to Tackle Third-Party Risk appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: China-Linked UNC3886 Targets Singapore Telecom Sector in Cyber Espionage Campaign
item.description: The Cyber Security Agency (CSA) of Singapore on Monday revealed that the China-nexus cyber espionage group known as UNC3886 targeted its telecommunications sector. "UNC3886 had launched a deliberate, targeted, and well-planned campaign against Singapore's telecommunications sector," CSA said. "All...

item.description: Microsoft has revealed that it observed a multi‑stage intrusion that involved the threat actors exploiting internet‑exposed SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) instances to obtain initial access and move laterally across the organization's network to other high-value assets. item.title: Ransomware Groups May Pivot Back to Encryption as Data Theft Tactics Falter
item.description: As only data exfiltration for extortion no longer delivers ROI, ransomware gangs may increasingly encrypting data for additional leverage. The post Ransomware Groups May Pivot Back to Encryption as Data Theft Tactics Falter appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cybersecurity M&A Roundup: 34 Deals Announced in January 2026
item.description: Significant cybersecurity M&A deals announced by CrowdStrike, Infoblox, JumpCloud, LevelBlue, OneSpan, and Radware. The post Cybersecurity M&A Roundup: 34 Deals Announced in January 2026 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: ⚡ Weekly Recap: AI Skill Malware, 31Tbps DDoS, Notepad++ Hack, LLM Backdoors and More
item.description: Cyber threats are no longer coming from just malware or exploits. They’re showing up inside the tools, platforms, and ecosystems organizations use every day. As companies connect AI, cloud apps, developer tools, and communication systems, attackers are following those same paths. A clear pattern...

item.title: Making AI Work, MIT Technology Review’s new AI newsletter, is here
item.description: For years, our newsroom has explored AI’s limitations and potential dangers, as well as its growing energy needs. item.title: How Top CISOs Solve Burnout and Speed up MTTR without Extra Hiring
item.description: Why do SOC teams keep burning out and missing SLAs even after spending big on security tools? Routine triage piles up, senior specialists get dragged into basic validation, and MTTR climbs, while stealthy threats still find room to slip through. Top CISOs have realized the solution isn’t hiring...

item.title: Bloody Wolf Targets Uzbekistan, Russia Using NetSupport RAT in Spear-Phishing Campaign
item.description: The threat actor known as Bloody Wolf has been linked to a campaign targeting Uzbekistan and Russia to infect systems with a remote access trojan known as NetSupport RAT. Cybersecurity vendor Kaspersky is tracking the activity under the moniker Stan Ghouls. The threat actor is known to be active...

item.title: Transformers.js v4 Preview: Now Available on NPM!
Experts Have World Models. LLMs Have Word Models.
item.description: Most expert work isn’t “produce a probable artifact”; it's "choose a good move considering other agents, guessing hidden state". LLMs default to single-shot artifacts and need World Models to progress
